name: Jimmy Bryan
introduction: James Ernest "Jimmy" Bryan (born January 28, 1926 in Phoenix, Arizona, United States  died June 19, 1960 at Langhorne Speedway, Langhorne, Pennsylvania, United States) was an American racing driver who competed in the Indianapolis 500 during the 1950s when it was a part of the Formula One World Championship, most notably winning the 1958 Indianapolis 500.  He was a three-time AAA/USAC champion.
